item.title: Report X-2024090739
item.description:
Report X-2024090739

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-11
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A pro was stacked on top of another and while a checker was pulling the stack off the trailer, the top pro fell off the stack and onto the drum below. The freight caused a small puncture near the top of the drum which caused roughly a quart to leak out onto the pallet below the drum. CURA was contac ted for remediation.

item.title: Report X-2024090637
item.description:
Report X-2024090637

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-12T09:14:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-03
  • City: ROUND ROCK
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: CONTENTS OF ONE IGLOO COOLER WRAPPED IN PLASTIC GOING TO CANADA WAS INSPECTED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE IGLOO COOLER, THERE IS APPROXIMATELY TEN POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING NON-REGULATED LOCTITE AA 334 MAGNET BONDER. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER IGLOO COOLER TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS SHIPPING AIR TO CANADA. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.description:
Report E-2024090122

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-11T09:14:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-13
  • City: BEAUMONT
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HONEYWELL INTERNATIONAL INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During a scheduled delivery there was what was thought to be vapors escaping from the nitrogen PRV on the cargo tank that was observed by customer personnel during the unloading. Unloading was stopped, problem diagnosed and unload completed without further incident. No liquid spilled, no further emergency response required.

item.title: Report E-2024090105
item.description:
Report E-2024090105

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-11T00:54:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-08
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver was dropping fuel when a car came between the truck and the curb and ran over the drop hose and drop fitting spilling about 30-50 gallons of fuel some of which went down a storm drain. Tank drop is damaged as is drop hose and drop gun. #2 tried to run over hose a second time but was prevented by driver
